name: Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon

reviews.text: Love the interior design of the hotel Staffs are friendly and the location is great. In the middle of Nathan rd walkin distance to Jordan MTR. During the day, there's lots of local eating places around. Even a wet market selling fresh veg and fruits are about 10 mins walk away. But nothing much in the neighbourhood at night. We shop in HK island till late and and return to hotel at 11pm. Realize there's not much to eat around the area and we travel to mongkok as there's more food option around that area. I stayed and Yau Ma Tei & Mongkok but Nathan is probably more on the quite side during the night.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at this Hotel. Initially it was a little hard to find but is well positioned and nice and central. The breakfast was great and the drinks at the club room are great way to relax and meet other travelers. Only down was no free wireless in the rooms although there were several iMacs available for guest use.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is child friendly, just off Kowloon road, close to many restaurants incl Mcdonalds just a five min walk. The hotel has excellent food. the Room Service is great and the Breakfast Buffet was fantastic and almost like a brunch. We were upgreded with the Accor Gold Status. We got some welcome drinks. The check in was a bit slow, but the rest was great. They have a good airport drop with a very reasonable price. very comfortable if you are traveling in a group or single. Lot of airline crew stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Recommended Downtown Hotel
pleasant stay
reviews.text: The room is pretty compact but comfortable with a king size bed. It provides all the usual facilities in the room except you have to pay to use the internet facilities. There are free internet service on the lobby though. Surrounding is convenient with shopping and eateries just outside the hotel. Service is good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a brilliant stay at the Novotel, Nathan Road. The service is excellent, plenty of choice for breakfast and very clean. There's also plenty of macs with internet access for people staying there to use and printing is free.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights on business, and ate in the Square restaurant both nights and mornings. This was the only downside to staying there. The staff were aloof, there were many on but not doing anything. Food was poor, I ate off their al a carte menu not their buffet. I travel alot and stay in a lot of Accor properties and was the worst food I've had.
reviews.title: Quick trip
Kowloon Shopping.
reviews.text: On a positive, the hotel is really modern, looks great and one of the best rooms I've stayed in.

reviews.title: Great hotel with very helpful concierge and staff
reviews.text: We oftern stay in Kowloon but this is the first time at this hotel. We booked a premier room, as we get similar at other hotels with Wifi and lounge access. Unfortunately the lounge food range was not that great, but still worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room was quite nice, but a bit small.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel

reviews.text: Staff were very friendly, and did their best to make sure everything was Ok.
reviews.title: Good family deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: one of the best aspects of Novotel Nathan Road is the great location... middle of Nathan Road.. about 5mins walk from the Jordan metro station... makes the hotel as the best place to stay...
reviews.title: great location... convenient stay
Go for the location, stay for the bar
reviews.text: very close to the famous ladies market, night market and jade market...

reviews.title: Exactly where you want to stay
reviews.text: rooms are kinda small .. but makes it difficult if you have more than 1 large suitcase...
bathrooms are fairly ok... utilization of space is well thought of.
reviews.title: Convenient stay!

reviews.text: I stayed on the Executive floor which proved to be an excellent choice. Our internet (wired and wireless) was included in the price as was breakfast; we chose to go down the restaurant on floor one every morning. The totals are just taken off the bill at the end. The executive floor lounge was a decent size and the food & drinks selection outstanding: I asked if they had any vegetarian sandwiches and a tray was immediately presented. Lovely little snacks for afternoon tea and cocktail hours, excellent service from the front desk. We were given access to a room for a quick wash in the evening after check out which was very kind.
reviews.title: Excellent venue

reviews.text: The rooms were more than large enough; the chaise lounge affair by the window was surprisingly comfortable. It is easy to plug in you computer on the spacious desk. The bathroom is well designed though I only had a shower, no bath tub. There is a kettle, cups etc and a small fridge. New arrivals are advised to step over the road to the 7/11 to pick up a few snacks rather than pay for the mini bar. There are two apple macs in the executive lounge and around another four in the bar on the first floor. The bar has a resident singing duo who are good and serves bar snack type meals.
reviews.title: My HKG Family Visit

reviews.text: The nearest MTR is Jordon. If you like vegetarian food go down the subway underneath Nathan Road: when you come up there is a restaurant on the corner called the Sino-vegetarian restaurant. You will also find another one down nathan road (south facing) turn left on Jordan road and look for a sign that says Light Vegetarian Restaurant. Laundries abound in this location. I used one on the road one block on from the Sino-vegetarian restaurant but i also noticed another one much nearer the hotel: turn left out of the hotel, then right. `You will see Professional Laundry on the corner a couple of blocks on. They all seem to offer about 7 pounds for around 32 HK dollars. If you want a taxi the young men in reception will step out and look for one for you driving past; you can also just walk down to Nathan Road and wave your hand. We didn't use a bus to get from the airport as for two of us the taxi was only 235 HK dollars. An Octopus card is worth getting as it saves you fussing with small change. There is a largish supermarket on Nathan Road called BILT. Look south, cross over the road, cross over the Jordan Road junction. You'll see a sign which points downwards to the super market.
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.text: You will be offered made to measure suits when you step out but the chaps are very pleasant and will eventually take no for an answer if you don't want to take them up.
reviews.title: Best in Downtown!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay as it is centrally located. Moving around is easy as it is near the MTR subway. Room is cleaan.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will continue to stay there in my next visit to Hong Kong
reviews.title: Worth Considering

reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights after a 4 week holiday in China, and found it to be comfortable, quiet and clean.
reviews.title: Best value

reviews.text: There are a few internet terminals in the lobby available for 30 mins, however they were nearly always busy so if you want to use them make sure you go early.
reviews.title: Recommend great location and value

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed here. The hotel can be a little hard to find, its entrance is off the sidestreet. We caught the Airport Express train into Kowloon, then the shuttle bus drops you off at Eaton Hotel, maybe a 60 metre walk north to the Novotel.
reviews.title: Ideal location for exploring Hong Kong

reviews.text: There is a 7-11 store right across the street which is handy. You can go down the side street towards Nathan Rd, go under Nathan Road using the subway. walk 2 blocks (maybe 50 metres) and you are in the middle of the night market. Down the first street are lots of really good restauarants.
reviews.title: Novotel Nathan Rd Kowloon Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week in Hong Kong and stayed here. As other reviewers have stated the rooms are small but perfectly formed. Our room looked out over the front of the hotel-not a great view. The room itself was comfortable, although we both found the bed to be a little too hard for us. The contol panel also took some working out!
reviews.title: Comfortable!

reviews.text: Our experience here was a positive one-check in was very quick as was check out. The staff were very friendly at all times and were most helpful if we had questions. We did not upgrade our room as breakfast was included in our package. We found the buffet breakfast to be quite satisfactory, although sometimes the hot food could have been hotter. Even on the days we had early tours and ate at 6.30am, some foods were still not very hot.
reviews.title: hotel with good location for shopping

reviews.text: We used the free internet stations in the lobby and never had any issues with getting access.
reviews.title: Great Location and good service

reviews.text: The hotel is located about 1.2km from the harbour. It took us 20mins to walk down Nathan Rd. We did not use the MTR or taxis as we were happy to walk. We did take the Star Ferry over to Hong Kong Island and this was very easy and cheap.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we came to Hong Kong again we would consider this hotel but would also investigate ones that were closer to the harbour.
reviews.title: Good location but lacking in service quality

reviews.text: A most enjoyable stay in a very good hotel, in a good location for Hong Kong generally. All of your staff were excellent, but I would like to make special mention of one of your concierges - Stanley Chow, who did much more than he needed to do, and who helped me greatly in a strange city.
reviews.title: VIBRANT HONG KONG

reviews.text: I have stayed at many hotels in Hong Kong. This hotel offers a better value with still having a nice location. I was a little disappointed that the lobby did not have free wireless.
reviews.title: Good value hotel on Kowloon

reviews.text: The title says it all. Aside from the good location and good service from the concierge team as well as a young front desk staff called Haydn Lee , there was not much to rave about this hotel.
reviews.title: 3-star hotel at 4-star price

reviews.text: When I checked in, my handphone was faulty and I asked the front desk whether they can help me contact my relatives. Mr Haydn Lee from the front desk immediately offered to dial the telephone number of my relative for me but as it was engaged, I had to wait again to dial later. When I asked another young front desk male staff to help me as Haydn was busy, his response was "Please go back to your room to make the call. The front desk is not meant to allow you to make calls from there!", although he eventually relented and told me it is only 1 call is allowed.
reviews.title: Hong Kong Layover

reviews.text: Is this level of service acceptable at such a hotel brand called Novotel?
reviews.title: Short Night Transit Stay

description: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon is conveniently located on bustling Nathan Road, in the heart of Kowloon's famous shopping and commercial district. The Hotel is proximity to the city's most conveneint MTR system and a short distance from various attractions such as the Temple Street Night Market, Ladies Market, and Jade Market, makes exploring the city's sights enjoyable and convenient. All rooms boast the latest Novotel “NEXT” room design features,equipped with Wi-Fi/broadband internet access and 32” flat screen TVs. All Executive rooms are equipped with ipod docking stations, a full range of Eco-certified bathroom amenities and free access to the private lounge, serving Continental breakfast or buffet, afternoon tea and evening cocktails. Free Wi-Fi is available in public areas. The Square restaurant serves international buffet spreads and an à la carte menu offering fresh seasonal seafood and healthy options. Tasca Bar offers live entertainment and a cosy atmosphere to unwind with a drink. Other facilities in the hotel include the In Balance Fitness Suite, Xbox games in the children’s play area and free internet usage at the iMac Corner and free WiFi in lobby areas and bar. Guests may enjoy a relaxing massage or arrange a day trip at the tour desk. One child (16 years and under) stays free when sharing with parents.
